brief: Quadritech combines the fields of Computing, Electronics, Mechanics, Telemetry, and Telecommunications to deliver solutions catered to the specific needs of the Brazilian Market, such as Hospitals, Driving Schools, Police and more.

projects.title: Online Written Test for obtaining a Driver's License in Brazil
projects.mainGoal: Create a platform that allows the application and monitoring of written tests to obtain a driver's license in Brazil (CNH), with real time anomaly monitoring, backed up by biometric data (passive liveness detection, head movements, browser monitoring, etc.), in addition to integration with each Brazilian state's DMV (DETRAN, in Portuguese) API.
projects.details: I am responsible for the entire project, from documentation, creation of use cases, management, architecture and Design System selection, database, to front-end and back-end development.
projects.outcomes: A Proof of Concept (PoC) of the application, with interfaces for users, examiners, and administrators. It also includes a question bank, as well as the basic biometric system for authentication and anomaly detection. Creation of a Design System Prototype which is being developed into the company's new Design System. Additionally, the implementation of an Event Driven Architecture is planned in order to normalize data between DETRAN's API and the legacy system.
projects.tech: : Express, React, Bootstrap, REST, MySQL, Laravel.

projects.title: Biometric Identification System for Citizens and Criminals
projects.mainGoal: Biometric registration and identification system for civilians and criminals, using facial and fingerprint biometric data, as well as signatures, for the state of Pará. The system integrates with the Police's database to link a suspet biometric data of suspects with biometric data from investigations, and also enables the printing of documents such as ID cards and functional records for civilians. It features mobile, desktop, and web components.
projects.details: I worked on the front-end design as well refactoring some back-end controllers, focusing on performance improvements and decoupling the logic from various controllers to enhance performance, modularity, and code maintainability.
projects.outcomes: A Proof of Concept (PoC) of a comprehensive system for registration and biometric identification of civilians and criminals, with mobile, web, and desktop components. The PoC enables real-time registration and authentication of civilians and criminals. Specifically, my frontend refactoring reduced the page loading time from 2 minutes to 10 seconds by utilizing lazy-loading techniques. Additionally, one of the tightly coupled controllers was divided into five separate endpoints. This restructuring allowed for the complete elimination of other controllers that implicitly used the same logic as these endpoints. This refactoring significantly improved the Developer Experience (DX).
projects.tech: PHP, Yii Framework 2, JavaScript, CSS, Bootstrap 5.

projects.title: Moodle Server Deployment and Maintenance
projects.mainGoal: Deploy a Moodle Server and maintain it with zero cost as long as possible.
projects.details: I was responsible for deploying the Moodle server and maintaining it while keeping in mind the School had $0 to invest in server maintenance when it was founded. I chose to use Google Cloud Platform because it had free credit for 12 months, which was enough time for the school to have funds to keep the server running. I chose a low code approach because maintaining the server was a secondary assignment that I did for free. I taught myself how to use GCP, Compute Engine and Data Buckets to backup the servers. I also implemented Google’s OAuth2 login system to make the login process easier for students and teachers.
projects.outcomes: The Moodle server which was used to apply tests to grade students.

projects.title: Data Good Practices Training
projects.mainGoal: Train staff to effectively use the Moodle server while keeping good practices in inserting and keeping data.
projects.details: I taught the teachers at Dord how to create questions for the question bank and to use a tag system that I created, which was human-readable. The tagging system was created as a foundation to implement AI-driven granular grading and studying suggestions as a long-term goal. I crafted video lessons and a manual for future reference. I also taught them how to navigate the system, create cohorts, tests, and everything they needed to keep their classes running properly.
projects.outcomes: A tagging system and a training course for the teachers.
